author: Deleted User
content: while I was calculating average gas prices per block, I found something that is quite interesting, but not newsworthy: miners (F2Pool in this instance) paying themselves very low (9 Gwei) gas prices when processing payouts to their members, like in this block: https://etherscan.io/block/10765854

author: Deleted User
content: the average gas price for that one was 14 gwei, that's why I picked it up ðŸ™‚

author: Deleted User
content: Thinking about this more - high gas prices probably hurt smaller mining pools, because they face a choice of either only do payouts within their own blocks (and forgo the revenue from including "paying" transactions), or paying really high fees to other pools

author: Deleted User
content: so it might be another mining centralisation vector, among others
